speaker: NESTOR
text_entry: ACT II

speaker: NESTOR
text_entry: SCENE I. A part of the Grecian camp.

speaker: NESTOR
text_entry: Enter AJAX and THERSITES

speaker: AJAX
text_entry: Thersites!

speaker: THERSITES
text_entry: Agamemnon, how if he had boils? full, all over,

speaker: THERSITES
text_entry: generally?

speaker: AJAX
text_entry: Thersites!

speaker: THERSITES
text_entry: And those boils did run? say so: did not the

speaker: THERSITES
text_entry: general run then? were not that a botchy core?

speaker: AJAX
text_entry: Dog!

speaker: THERSITES
text_entry: Then would come some matter from him; I see none now.

speaker: AJAX
text_entry: Thou bitch-wolf's son, canst thou not hear?

speaker: AJAX
text_entry: Beating him

speaker: AJAX
text_entry: Feel, then.

speaker: THERSITES
text_entry: The plague of Greece upon thee, thou mongrel

speaker: THERSITES
text_entry: beef-witted lord!

speaker: AJAX
text_entry: Speak then, thou vinewedst leaven, speak: I will

speaker: AJAX
text_entry: beat thee into handsomeness.

speaker: THERSITES
text_entry: I shall sooner rail thee into wit and holiness: but,

speaker: THERSITES
text_entry: I think, thy horse will sooner con an oration than

speaker: THERSITES
text_entry: thou learn a prayer without book. Thou canst strike,

speaker: THERSITES
text_entry: canst thou? a red murrain o' thy jade's tricks!

speaker: AJAX
text_entry: Toadstool, learn me the proclamation.

speaker: THERSITES
text_entry: Dost thou think I have no sense, thou strikest me thus?

speaker: AJAX
text_entry: The proclamation!

speaker: THERSITES
text_entry: Thou art proclaimed a fool, I think.

speaker: AJAX
text_entry: Do not, porpentine, do not: my fingers itch.

speaker: THERSITES
text_entry: I would thou didst itch from head to foot and I had

speaker: THERSITES
text_entry: the scratching of thee; I would make thee the

speaker: THERSITES
text_entry: loathsomest scab in Greece. When thou art forth in

speaker: THERSITES
text_entry: the incursions, thou strikest as slow as another.

speaker: AJAX
text_entry: I say, the proclamation!

speaker: THERSITES
text_entry: Thou grumblest and railest every hour on Achilles,

speaker: THERSITES
text_entry: and thou art as full of envy at his greatness as

speaker: THERSITES
text_entry: Cerberus is at Proserpine's beauty, ay, that thou

speaker: THERSITES
text_entry: barkest at him.

speaker: AJAX
text_entry: Mistress Thersites!

speaker: THERSITES
text_entry: Thou shouldest strike him.

speaker: AJAX
text_entry: Cobloaf!

speaker: THERSITES
text_entry: He would pun thee into shivers with his fist, as a

speaker: THERSITES
text_entry: sailor breaks a biscuit.

speaker: AJAX
text_entry: [Beating him]  You whoreson cur!

speaker: THERSITES
text_entry: Do, do.

speaker: AJAX
text_entry: Thou stool for a witch!

speaker: THERSITES
text_entry: Ay, do, do; thou sodden-witted lord! thou hast no

speaker: THERSITES
text_entry: more brain than I have in mine elbows; an assinego

speaker: THERSITES
text_entry: may tutor thee: thou scurvy-valiant ass! thou art

speaker: THERSITES
text_entry: here but to thrash Trojans; and thou art bought and

speaker: THERSITES
text_entry: sold among those of any wit, like a barbarian slave.

speaker: THERSITES
text_entry: If thou use to beat me, I will begin at thy heel, and

speaker: THERSITES
text_entry: tell what thou art by inches, thou thing of no

speaker: THERSITES
text_entry: bowels, thou!

speaker: AJAX
text_entry: You dog!

speaker: THERSITES
text_entry: You scurvy lord!

speaker: AJAX
text_entry: [Beating him]  You cur!

speaker: THERSITES
text_entry: Mars his idiot! do, rudeness; do, camel; do, do.

speaker: THERSITES
text_entry: Enter ACHILLES and PATROCLUS

speaker: ACHILLES
text_entry: Why, how now, Ajax! wherefore do you thus? How now,

speaker: ACHILLES
text_entry: Thersites! what's the matter, man?

speaker: THERSITES
text_entry: You see him there, do you?

speaker: ACHILLES
text_entry: Ay; what's the matter?

speaker: THERSITES
text_entry: Nay, look upon him.

speaker: ACHILLES
text_entry: So I do: what's the matter?

speaker: THERSITES
text_entry: Nay, but regard him well.

speaker: ACHILLES
text_entry: 'Well!' why, I do so.

speaker: THERSITES
text_entry: But yet you look not well upon him; for whosoever you

speaker: THERSITES
text_entry: take him to be, he is Ajax.

speaker: ACHILLES
text_entry: I know that, fool.

speaker: THERSITES
text_entry: Ay, but that fool knows not himself.

speaker: AJAX
text_entry: Therefore I beat thee.

speaker: THERSITES
text_entry: Lo, lo, lo, lo, what modicums of wit he utters! his

speaker: THERSITES
text_entry: evasions have ears thus long. I have bobbed his

speaker: THERSITES
text_entry: brain more than he has beat my bones: I will buy

speaker: THERSITES
text_entry: nine sparrows for a penny, and his pia mater is not

speaker: THERSITES
text_entry: worth the nineth part of a sparrow. This lord,

speaker: THERSITES
text_entry: Achilles, Ajax, who wears his wit in his belly and

speaker: THERSITES
text_entry: his guts in his head, I'll tell you what I say of

speaker: THERSITES
text_entry: him.

speaker: ACHILLES
text_entry: What?

speaker: THERSITES
text_entry: I say, this Ajax--

speaker: THERSITES
text_entry: Ajax offers to beat him

speaker: ACHILLES
text_entry: Nay, good Ajax.

speaker: THERSITES
text_entry: Has not so much wit--

speaker: ACHILLES
text_entry: Nay, I must hold you.

speaker: THERSITES
text_entry: As will stop the eye of Helen's needle, for whom he

speaker: THERSITES
text_entry: comes to fight.

speaker: ACHILLES
text_entry: Peace, fool!

speaker: THERSITES
text_entry: I would have peace and quietness, but the fool will

speaker: THERSITES
text_entry: not: he there: that he: look you there.

speaker: AJAX
text_entry: O thou damned cur! I shall--

speaker: ACHILLES
text_entry: Will you set your wit to a fool's?

speaker: THERSITES
text_entry: No, I warrant you; for a fools will shame it.

speaker: PATROCLUS
text_entry: Good words, Thersites.

speaker: ACHILLES
text_entry: What's the quarrel?

speaker: AJAX
text_entry: I bade the vile owl go learn me the tenor of the

speaker: AJAX
text_entry: proclamation, and he rails upon me.

speaker: THERSITES
text_entry: I serve thee not.

speaker: AJAX
text_entry: Well, go to, go to.

speaker: THERSITES
text_entry: I serve here voluntarily.

speaker: ACHILLES
text_entry: Your last service was sufferance, 'twas not

speaker: ACHILLES
text_entry: voluntary: no man is beaten voluntary: Ajax was

speaker: ACHILLES
text_entry: here the voluntary, and you as under an impress.

speaker: THERSITES
text_entry: E'en so; a great deal of your wit, too, lies in your

speaker: THERSITES
text_entry: sinews, or else there be liars. Hector have a great

speaker: THERSITES
text_entry: catch, if he knock out either of your brains: a'

speaker: THERSITES
text_entry: were as good crack a fusty nut with no kernel.

speaker: ACHILLES
text_entry: What, with me too, Thersites?

speaker: THERSITES
text_entry: There's Ulysses and old Nestor, whose wit was mouldy

speaker: THERSITES
text_entry: ere your grandsires had nails on their toes, yoke you

speaker: THERSITES
text_entry: like draught-oxen and make you plough up the wars.

speaker: ACHILLES
text_entry: What, what?

speaker: THERSITES
text_entry: Yes, good sooth: to, Achilles! to, Ajax! to!

speaker: AJAX
text_entry: I shall cut out your tongue.

speaker: THERSITES
text_entry: 'Tis no matter! I shall speak as much as thou

speaker: THERSITES
text_entry: afterwards.

speaker: PATROCLUS
text_entry: No more words, Thersites; peace!

speaker: THERSITES
text_entry: I will hold my peace when Achilles' brach bids me, shall I?

speaker: ACHILLES
text_entry: There's for you, Patroclus.

speaker: THERSITES
text_entry: I will see you hanged, like clotpoles, ere I come

speaker: THERSITES
text_entry: any more to your tents: I will keep where there is

speaker: THERSITES
text_entry: wit stirring and leave the faction of fools.

speaker: THERSITES
text_entry: Exit

speaker: PATROCLUS
text_entry: A good riddance.

speaker: ACHILLES
text_entry: Marry, this, sir, is proclaim'd through all our host:

speaker: ACHILLES
text_entry: That Hector, by the fifth hour of the sun,

speaker: ACHILLES
text_entry: Will with a trumpet 'twixt our tents and Troy

speaker: ACHILLES
text_entry: To-morrow morning call some knight to arms

speaker: ACHILLES
text_entry: That hath a stomach; and such a one that dare

speaker: ACHILLES
text_entry: Maintain--I know not what: 'tis trash. Farewell.

speaker: AJAX
text_entry: Farewell. Who shall answer him?

speaker: ACHILLES
text_entry: I know not: 'tis put to lottery; otherwise

speaker: ACHILLES
text_entry: He knew his man.

speaker: AJAX
text_entry: O, meaning you. I will go learn more of it.

speaker: AJAX
text_entry: Exeunt
